meanings.definition: A series of columns set at regular intervals and usually supporting the base of a roof structure.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had majestic colonnades that held up the roof.
meanings.sent2: The grand palace entrance featured beautiful colonnades on either side.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the colonnades as a playground, hopping from column to column.
meanings.sent4: The colonnades stood like loyal soldiers, steadfastly supporting the weight above.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the shadows cast by the colonnades created a mesmerizing pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: A structure composed of a series of columns typically supporting a roof or entablature.
meanings.sent1: Tourists marveled at the ancient colonnades that adorned the temple.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the new building with elegant colonnades to add a touch of sophistication.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons perched on the colonnades, looking like tiny guardians of the structure.
meanings.sent4: The colonnades embraced the sky, reaching towards the heavens with grace.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain echoed softly under the protective cover of the colonnades.
